title: Commander Keen on the Run!
content:

The site is Called "Commander Keen on the Run" and/or "Commander Keen's Big Run" and is an old site I made a LONNNGGG time ago remade to celebrate 17 years of Commander Keen (1990 to 2007)........

title: Re: Commander Keen on the Run!
content:
What flaming?
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img]

Btw, you said you suck at HTML, so why didn't you just use a WYSIWYG editor, like Dreamweaver or Mozilla composer or whatever? It can make things look reasonable...

Now, about the site.
- The colour scheme is horrible. Avoid fully red/green/blue/yellow/pink colours, always use a darker or lighter shade. Green, blue and "pink" have RGB 0,255,0; 0,0,255; 255,0,255. See the relation? Avoid 255 vs 0, because these colours are eye-hurting and contrasting too much!
- Don't resize images on your page, in fact, don't give them fixed sizes at all in the HTML tags. Just let the images display on their original size. Anything else will make it look ugly.
- You resized tons of stuff in that one logo image. Avoid. Keep everything at a scale of 100% or 200%, but don't resize to something like 124% because that will make the resized graphics look ugly.
- Don't overdo the dots................... It's kinda annoying reading text that way...................
- Use a font that looks nice. Arial, Verdana, heck, maybe even Times. But avoid non-truetype fonts like Fixedsys.
- Barely any content. Only some text about what the games are, but no downloads, no further info, no fanfic/fanart... I don't really see for what purpose you made this other than explaining with lots of dots what Keen is all about.

In short, work seriously on a good site if you want people to be interested and visit/come back to the site.


EDIT: sfafsfs? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] ____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: Re: Commander Keen on the Run!
content:
Back in my day, we had to walk 10 miles in the snow to get to a sweet shop, uphill both ways. And when we got there, they only had one sweet and it wasn't any good, but we ate it anyway for some reason.

Disclaimer: The previous paragraph may or may not be true.------------------
Nothing in particular

title: Re: Criticism!
content:
Oh! Green! RGB #00FF00 (or its decimal form, 0,255,0)! Even with the LCD display it hurts my eyes! Mwaaaa I dieeee!!

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img] Back on topic...

Seriously, I had to hurry and copy your web page's text onto Notepad before reading it. You caused me a bad headache. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-redeyes.gif[/img]

The following quotes, unless explicitly stated in bold text, come from the green webpage in question.
[quote]Quote:[hr]sfafsfs[hr][/quote]
What's that supposed to be? Well, maybe you understand.
EDIT: I didn't notice that before, but it seems that I'm not the only one who wonders what "sfafsfs" is.
[quote]Quote:[hr]Series 1: Invasion of the Vorticons. It starts with a 9 (I think) year old boy[hr][/quote]
Actually, Keen was 8 years old then. And it isn't difficult to find that fact, just download the shareware Keen1 episode, play it and look at the help screen.
[quote]Quote:[hr][...]I remember my buddy calling the gargs (right name?)[hr][/quote]
Yes.
[quote]Quote:[hr][...]you may also have the joy of abliterating the Vorticons[hr][/quote]
Ehem. *launches MS-DOS editor and looks for uncompressed KEEN2.EXE*...
[quote]Quote:[hr]The Vorticon Elder said: The Grand Intellect is not from Vorticon VI--he is from the planet Earth. His evil Mind-Belts control their minds. They are not evil. Please do not shoot them, human.[hr][/quote]
That's it.
[quote]Quote:[hr][...]where you must find The Grand Intelligence.[hr][/quote]
Grand Intellect.
[quote]Quote:[hr][...]Something about the Shakidi (right name?)[hr][/quote]
Shikadi, please.
[quote]Quote:[hr][...]and has to make it through the ship, to destroy the Shakidi (???) Master.[hr][/quote]
To destroy the QED, Quantum Explosion Dynamo. Nothing more (and the Shikadi Master is invincible in Keen 5).
---------------------------------------------------
OK, I'm annoying when I criticize people, but I think nobody should write a dedicated web page if he/she doesn't know exactly what the object of dedication is all about. I could go and write a page about the Theory of Relativity (or whatever it's called), but, what is the point if I don't know what the Theory of Relativity is?
[hr][img]http://img136.imageshack.us/img136/983/vegetableswk2.gif[/img]

title: Re: Commander Keen on the Run!
content:
It's simple: there are forums that are noob-friendly, and forums where people hate and bash noobs. We're pretty friendly towards noobs here, IF they take the time to start improving their posted work.

I barely see a flame war. Only (most) people giving constructive criticism and telling you why your site isn't attractive at all.

Ok, about the site now.
- The darkish green makes the links hard to read. Seriously, set up your monitor and use an even darker shade of green. Change the link colours too, since they're difficult to read right now.
- Too many horizontal rainbow bars. Cut down on them.
- Still lacking a lot, see my previous post.____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]
